titles.title: To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow certain counties flexibility in spending funds.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (as amended by the Improving America's Schools Act of 1994), in order to allow certain counties flexibility in spending funds received under basic grants to local educational agencies, to repeal requirements for: (1) determining the number of children aged five to 17 from families below the poverty line; and (2) biennial population updates on the number of such children.
